general.headline: Associate at KWL Lawyers
general.description:
Andrew joined KWL Lawyers in March 2016.

As a Team Leader and Associate of the firm, Andrew manages a team of solicitors working alongside them in various areas of law including Litigation, Family Law, Criminal and Traffic Law, Bankruptcy/Insolvency and Building and Construction Law.

Andrew’s extensive experience allows him to possess the right attitude and motive, increasing his ability to properly identify his client’s needs and wants while working towards a resolution for them. 

Andrew always strives to obtain the best outcome for his clients through his devotion to the law and resourceful attitude.

Andrew is a Solicitor of the Supreme Court of New South Wales and High Court of Australia, as well as a member of the Law Society of New South Wales. 

Andrew has appeared in many jurisdictions including the Local Court, District Court, Supreme Court, Federal Court, Family Court and the New South Wales Civil and Administrative Tribunal. His experience also expands into adjudication applications within the Building and Construction Industry Security of Payment Act 1999.

Irrespective of the jurisdiction, his main objective is providing legal services in a just, quick and efficient manner. 

Outside of work you can find Andrew at the Eastern Creek Raceway pursuing his other passion – racing cars or otherwise at the gym.

Andrew is contactable via email: andrew@kwllawyers.com.au 
.

general.headline: Partner | Workplace Health & Safety, Employment & Labour | Norton Rose Fulbright Australia
general.description:
Aaron Anderson is a partner in the Employment and Labour team who has a specialist focus in  occupational health and safety law.  

Aaron has extensive experience in advising clients on occupational health and safety, employment and industrial relations related matters in various industries including rail, mining, infrastructure, food safety, manufacturing, electricity and transport.  He is an advisor to government and also assists clients in broader regulatory matters, including enterprise risk management and governance. 

An experienced advocate, he has successfully defended a number of prosecutions on behalf of clients as well as appearing before industrial relations commissions, coronial inquiries and the Royal Commission into the Home Insulation Program.    

Aaron is also an active trainer and presenter and is regularly invited to present at key industry conferences.

He is the author of the publication Mining Safety Law in Australia (Lexis Nexis, 2012) and was selected for inclusion in the 7th Edition of Best Lawyers in Australia in the practice area of Occupational Health & Safety Law.

He is also a volunteer Director of Help Me With It.

aaron.anderson@nortonrosefulbright.com

general.headline: Partner at Norton Rose Fulbright Australia

jobs.description:
Leading the Restructuring & Insolvency practice at Norton Rose Fulbright Australia, Steven has extensive experience across a range of industries.  His areas of expertise include corporate restructuring and insolvency, cross border insolvency, security enforcement, insolvent trading and preference claims, managed investment schemes and complex financial instruments, directors' obligations and duties, and advice on trusts and equitable rights.  He advises financiers, creditors, directors, and insolvency practitioners and has acted in numerous complex litigious matters as well as many informal restructures.

Steven has played a key role in some of the most significant and complex insolvency matters, including acting for the receivers and managers of Opes Prime Stockbroking during 2008-9, the liquidators of Sonray Capital Markets Pty Ltd, the administrators and liquidators of large forestry managed investment schemes including the Great Southern companies and Environinvest Limited and the receivers and managers of the Raine Square development in Perth’s CBD and the receivers and managers of Forge Group Limited and its subsidiaries.

Steven has also been involved in significant restructuring matters including acting for the court appointed receivers of the Black Swan dips business in its restructure and sale, acting for the responsible entities of the Elders Ltd Managed Investment Schemes in their restructure and in numerous confidential assignments.

Steven has been recognised as a leading insolvency lawyer in various legal directories, including Chambers and Partners, who recently refer to him as “…incredibly commercial, switched on and street smart.  He doesn't waste time and doesn't litigate for sake of it.” He is also ranked in the Experts Guide to the World’s Leading Insolvency & Restructuring Lawyers, Best Lawyers, Doyles Guide, APL500 and IFLR.

allSkills: Commercial Litigation, Legal Advice, Dispute Resolution, Restructuring, Corporate Law, Corporate Governance, Litigation, Due Diligence, Bankruptcy, Cross-border Transactions, Joint Ventures, Litigation Support, Alternative Dispute Resolution, Liquidation, Receiverships

general.description: Grant is a senior associate in Norton Rose Fulbright’s International Asset Finance Group now based in Australia specialising in the shipping finance and offshore oil and gas sectors. Grant has over 15 years’ of experience advising financial institutions, shipping/energy companies, lessors, private equity funds and government agencies in connection with all types of secured lending, leasing, multi-jurisdictional sale and purchase transactions and newbuilding finance. He has advised on a wide range of transactions in the shipping and offshore oil and gas sectors (including for LNG vessels, FPSO’s and drilling/production rigs) and in the equipment leasing and finance sectors and has extensive experience in syndicated cross-border asset and structured debt financing, cross-border leasing, off-balance sheet structures, export credit financing, receivables financing, restructurings and the sale and purchase / sale and leaseback of vessels in the offshore oil and gas and shipping sectors.

general.headline: Partner | Intellectual Property, Head of CSR | Norton Rose Fulbright Australia
general.description:
Jackie O’Brien is an intellectual property lawyer with more than 30 years’ experience.  Jackie has extensive experience in IP litigation including patent, copyright and trade mark litigation, and is highly regarded for her skill in project managing large and complex IP litigation matters, particularly those with global implications.

Described as the “consummate professional” by a major client she has demonstrated legal and technical versatility in matters across a broad range of industry sectors including pharmaceuticals, mining, food technology, lighting technology, personal care products and financial services. 
She is ranked in Chambers Global, Best Lawyers, Managing Intellectual Property and World Trade Mark Reporter as a leader in her field, and won the Partner of the Year Award in the 2014 Lawyers Weekly Australian Law Awards for the strength of her practice, the contribution she makes to the Norton Rose Fulbright corporate social responsibility program and her role as a mentor to other women.   

Jackie is a member of Norton Rose Fulbright Australia's Management Committee, Chair of the firm's CSR Committee, National Pro Bono Partner, and a member of the firm's National Diversity & Inclusion and Graduate Recruitment Committees.

She advises on corporate and securities law, including capital raisings, continuous disclosure and ASX compliance, resources law, corporate governance and compliance, joint ventures, directors' duties, share and asset sales and acquisitions, commercial agreements and financial services. general.headline: Partner  | Financial Restructuring and Insolvency | Norton Rose Fulbright Australia
general.description:
Peter Schmidt is a restructuring and insolvency lawyer based in Brisbane. 

He has over 20 years’ experience in commercial disputes and insolvency & restructuring. His clients include banks, financial institutions and insolvency accountants. 

Peter sits on the Board of ARITA (Australian Restructuring Insolvency and Turnaround Association Association), the Law Council of Australia’s Insolvency and Reconstruction Queensland Sub-Committee. 

He has particular expertise in corporate turnaround and recovery, advising secured lenders on debt management and secured loan recovery, acting for receivers, liquidators, voluntary administrators and trustees in corporate and personal insolvencies, dispute resolution and mediation, risk management and recovery of commercial debts and disputes over commercial and property contracts and arrangements.

Peter started the firm’s Queensland business recovery practice in 1997.

He has been voted by peers as one of Australia's best lawyers in insolvency and reorganisation each year since 2008 in The Australian Financial Review's ‘Best Lawyers’ supplements.

general.description:
Martin is a highly experienced and well regarded lawyer in the areas of resources and energy, commercial and construction law.  His practice includes joint ventures, the acquisition and disposal of oil and gas and mining assets, as well as unregulated M&A in the infrastructure and corporate sectors generally. 
He has also substantial experience in resources/energy project and infrastructure development, including roads and rail and social infrastructure PPPs.  
Martin recently returned to Melbourne after working for nearly three years with a global law firm in London, where he was mostly involved in upstream oil and gas and mining M&A and development projects in Africa and Europe as well as gas sales and transportation agreements.
Before that, Martin was based in Melbourne but has also worked in Perth, Shanghai and Germany and was an in-house lawyer at Newcrest Mining in Melbourne for 2 years in the mid 90's.
Martin is currently the National President of the Australian Mining and Petroleum Law Association, AMPLA.

general.description:
I have 25 years experience in acting for bidders and targets focussing on mergers and acquisitions (M&A) including takeovers and schemes of arrangement, as well as initial public offerings and capital raisings. My focus covers international transactions, the Takeovers Panel, directors duties, private mergers & acquisitions, corporate governance advice, Listing Rules compliance, Corporations Act advice, and capital restructurings.

I am recognized as a leading recommended lawyer by each of Chambers Global (2017 to 2012, mergers and acquisitions), APL500 (2015 to 2013, mergers and acquisitions), IFLR1000 (2017 to 2012, financial and corporate law), Chambers Asia Pacific (2017 to 2011, corporate / mergers and acquisitions), Best Lawyers in Australia (2017 to 2015, mergers & acquisitions and equity capital markets) and Doyles (2016 to 2015 and 2013, capital markets and corporate law).

Chambers Asia Pacific 2017 states: "Richard Lustig impresses both peers and clients with a versatile blend of knowledge, pragmatism, resourcefulness and proactivity.  Offering over 20 years experience in the representation of both bidders and targets, he is noted for his Corporations Act expertise and for assisting in the co-ordination of client relationships on a global basis."  

Chambers Global 2016 states: "Richard Lustig is characterised by a source as 'one of those people you need and respect because you feel that they are on your wavelength and can get the job done'.  Recognised for his in-depth knowledge of Corporations Act and ASX listing issues he is also experienced in the handling of cross -border transactions."

Details of various matters I have worked on and publications and releases issued can be found at http://www.bakermckenzie.com/RichardLustig/ 

Good to see Baker McKenzie recognised as the leading M&A law firm for the first quarter of 2017: http://www.bakermckenzie.com/en/newsroom/2017/04/thomson-reuters-ma-in-australia

general.headline: Paralegal at Baker McKenzie | Juris Doctor Candidate at Melbourne Law School
general.description:
I am currently studying law at the University of Melbourne after having spent seven months backpacking and living in Europe over the course of 2015. Over the course of my travel, I gained a new and more worldly perspective on so many aspects of life through visiting exciting places and meeting interesting people. I have also gained valuable skills of self-reliance, humility and assertiveness by being pushed outside of my comfort zone at many points in the trip. I studied history and classics in my undergraduate degree, and it has always been a passion for me, which made my highlights during my travel the many different historical locations and remnants that I was able to witness on my journey.

So far, studying at Melbourne Law School has been one the most empowering and rewarding period of my life. The calibre of my peers has challenged me to reach my highest potential and made me realise the breadth of opportunities that are open to me. The degree itself has not only given me an understanding of the law, but has improved my work ethic, critical thinking, logical reasoning, and public speaking skills. 

I consider myself to be a kind and thoughtful person, and enjoy being good company to those around me. I am often commended on my hard work ethic and professional manner, and pride myself on my social skills. I am an avid supporter of the Essendon Football Club and enjoy the opportunities when I get to watch them play in person. Some of my other hobbies and interests include strength training, reading, writing and history.

I have worked for Camberwell Swim School between 2008 and 2017, where I taught squad and ‘learn to swim’ classes with kids between the ages of 3 and 16. Through teaching swimming I have gained invaluable communicative skills and learnt to handle responsibility.

I have aspired to work as a lawyer for several years now, and I am excited by the skills of detail analysis and advocacy, intrinsic to law.

general.headline: Special Counsel at Piper Alderman
general.description:
Lucy joined Piper Alderman's Brisbane Dispute Resolution & Litigation team in June 2017. 

Lucy qualified as a lawyer in London in 2003 while working in the professional liability and commercial litigation department of leading insurance law firm Barlow Lyde & Gilbert (since merged with Clyde & Co).  In 2006 Lucy moved to Australia, taking up a commercial litigation role with top tier Australian law firm Blake Dawson Waldron, which later merged with leading international law firm Ashurst.  Lucy worked at Ashurst until 2015, after which she spent two years as an Employability Specialist at the University of Queensland, working with the TC Beirne School of Law.

Managed and advised on a range of litigation and dispute resolution matters, across industries including mining and resources, property, insolvency and financial services.  Worked as part of both small and large teams in jurisdictions including the Queensland Supreme Court, the Federal Court of Australia and a Queensland Commission of Inquiry.

Assisted on a range of professional liability and commercial litigation disputes, including negligence claims involving solicitors, barristers, accountants, auditors and property professionals, and policy coverage disputes. Lauren has expertise in managing complex projects, particularly in the infrastructure space.   She has worked on both the economic, finance and commercial and engineering sides on consultancy firms and can seamlessly integrate workstreams across different disciplines.

Lauren is a trained Investment Logic Mapping Facilitator which is critical for engagements with complex stakeholder involvement.

Lauren is also the Founder and Director of The Inside Entrepreneur, an executive coaching practice that focuses on unleashing the potential of intrapreneurs – those ambitious individuals that are often hidden within big organisations.

Specialties: Infrastructure Development, Business Case, Smart Cities, Investment Logic Mapping, Economics, Executive Coaching.

jobs.description:
Our Infrastructure Advisory practice works with government and project sponsors to assist in optimising transaction outcomes when working on major infrastructure and industrial projects. These transactions comprise social and economic infrastructure assets.

Our work involves managing major infrastructure projects, providing oversight and essential understanding of an infrastructure project from ‘cradle to grave’. Our advice covers the full spectrum of considerations over the entire infrastructure lifecycle. This includes financial and economic analysis and development of business cases through to involvement in complex procurement and project transaction phases.

Key responsibilities include: 
• Independently leading project teams
• Undertaking strategic, financial and commercial analysis for public and private clients in a variety of sectors
• Assisting in the pursuit of business development opportunities and leading the development of proposals
• Delivering complete engagements including billing, work-in-progress, fee negotiations and risk management.

Smart Cities Council ANZ task forces bring together leading practitioners who work as trusted advisors with public sector leaders and other stakeholders to raise awareness about the smart cities strategies that are improving the liveability, workability and sustainability of communities around the globe. 

The Urban Mobility taskforce advocates for sustainable and inclusive mobility systems that build liveable cities.

The Inside Entrepreneur is a coaching and consulting firm focused on unleashing the potential of intrapreneurs – ambitious individuals that are often hidden within big organisations.

We help you to build self-awareness, create opportunity and help you unlock your potential and maximise your performance

Through examining your current ways of thinking, actions and behaviours, we help you to define what success means to you and how you can create the impact in the world that you're looking for.

I have developed and applied methods for identifying the economic implications of transport and urban renewal projects, both following conventional appraisal practices as well as using innovative and cutting edge approaches to predict the ‘real’ economic impacts of projects.

general.description:
Terry has over 15 years of professional service delivery, business consultancy, business development and construction management experience. An entrepreneurial high performing executive with a proven track record of delivering large scale complex projects, executive level client account management and strategically developing & closing new solution based business opportunities specialising in Telecommunication equipment, professional services and digital infrastructure.
Terry has been working with both local and international telecommunications carriers over the last decade including leading the establishment of large consultancy telecommunication operations in Italy, the Middle East, Europe and Australia with large consultancy firms with annual turnovers of 65b +.
From a rollout perspective, Terry has managed senior 100m+ accounts with Telstra, Vodafone, Optus, NBN and Huawei covering a complete end to end solution from bid management, procurement, operational architecture, engagement of both technical internal resources and subcontractors, contract management, scope management, cost management, final delivery acceptance and tight commercial controlling. jobs.description:
GHD is one of the world's leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation.

Reporting to the Global Market Leader, Terry was responsible for leading a dedicated team of 80+ internal and outsourced professional services resources whom collaborate to draw on GHD’s expertise in consulting, advisory, design, planning & construction management to deliver valuable outcomes for our clients which include federal and state government, large listed organizations such as; Telstra, Vodafone, Optus & NBN.

Terry was responsible for delivering both the executive strategies of the business, helping our clients to solve their complex problems and accountable for delivering contractual terms for clients nationally across the digital infrastructure group.

Accenture is the world’s largest multinational management consulting firm, with revenues in excess of $60.0 billion, with more than 450,000 employees serving clients in more than 250 cities in 135 countries. 

Reporting to the Global Managing Director of CMT, Terry was initially headhunted for the position to leverage both his understanding of the local communication landscape and executive network with Australian carriers.

Incorporating the local knowledge, Terry was also responsible for delivering Accenture’s value proposition to its customers to enable its diamond clients objectives are meet and to industrialize their networks to operate more efficiently and look at CAPEX and OPEX reductions across its operations.

The global Swiss company Huber + Suhner develops and manufactures components and system solutions for electrical and optical transportation of data and energy.

Reporting to the Global MD, Terry successfully led the establishment of the telecommunication and rail comms construction services department locally and in the US which consisted of, EHS documentation, Quality management processes, Cyber security processes & client prequalification process management.
Following the successful completion of the department, Terry went on to both manage the internal telecom division with the overall accountability of program deliver.

Service Stream provides asset owners and operators with essential infrastructure services, offering fixed, mobile communication, electricity, gas and water utilities.

Reporting to the Executive General Manager, Terry was accountable for wireless delivering for multiple programs across Telstra network portfolio. Managing a large 50 + professional services, which provided end to end services from RF engineering through to site integration.
During my time at SSMC I was tasked with establishing a team to deliver the first release of 4G LTE services in Australia. Terry and the team created a work instruction, WBS and engaged outsourced technical contractors to rollout 4G for Optus in Newcastle located in NSW, the project was successfully delivered and mirrored nationally.

PIC Group was a Sydney based commercial and residential property development firm, focusing on general property management tasks, including; rent roll variance, reporting and client approvals. Assisting the sales teams with workshops and sales management.
Reporting to the Head of Sales, Terry focused on delivering corporate property portfolio management and moved across the commercial sales departments upon requests.

general.headline: Managing Delivery and Operational Risk in Telecoms and Infrastructure
general.description:
Are you a CEO, CIO, Director, MD, Program Director or Business Development Manager delivering critical Infrastructure and ICT projects? Are you an infrastructure investor or manager?

Asset delivery, operation and disposal programs are time constrained to business drivers and multiple risk potentials. A 2011 report from the Victorian Ombudsman into ICT related projects found that “None of the projects investigated was well planned. Agencies failed to commit the necessary time and effort into planning and business case development, which led to significant differences between the planned and actual time, costs and outcomes”. 

The lost time and cost increases of the affected programs often result in lost productivity and brand damage for the sponsor and delivery organisations.

Program development and planning is always constrained however the investment of time and effort in a structured risk planning and governance processes will yield positive results in managing technical, commercial and stakeholder risks through the lifecycle of infrastructure programs.

For over 20 years, I have developed and implemented commercial and technical strategies for infrastructure investors, telecoms project delivery, technology and engineering bids and industry safety programs.

I engage with key stakeholders to understand their needs and act as the translator between business objectives and technology delivery through meaningful connections between people and with organisations and place the highest priority on my client’s needs ahead of mine. Infrastructure is my business and I strive to understand the risks and communicate the path to optimum outcomes. 

Whether its a program delivery challenge, asset acquisition, tender proposal, project health review or team mentoring I'm up for the challenge.

To learn more about how you can deliver your infrastructure program with certainty and credibility, please contact me via email on Tony.Paul@piconet.com.au or call me on +61 408 765 008.

general.headline: Managing Principal at McCabe Curwood Lawyers
general.description:
I am the Managing Principal of McCabe Curwood. 

My experience in Corporations law matters and in particular director's disputes and shareholder disputes has seen me be successful in the Supreme Court of NSW, the Federal Court and the High Court of Australia. 

I have significant experience and expertise in disputes involving the Competition and Consumer Act (formerly the Trade Practices Act). I also act for a number of insolvency practitioners, and provide advice to directors and shareholders on all aspects of insolvency, with emphasis on corporate insolvency. 

My clients range from medium to large Australian and International businesses, across a variety of industries including manufacturing, property, insurance and finance.

I develop and execute strategies to guide clients through what can be stressful situations. I am accessible, pragmatic and commercial. Not only does the team at McCabe Curwood pride itself on technical excellence, I ensure our clients are kept up to date with all developments in their matter, in a language they can understand.

McCabe Curwood's litigation and dispute resolution group operate as a highly efficient, quality-focused team. My reputation for quality work has allowed me to form relationships with the top barristers in NSW.

If you would like to know more about my practice areas or are in need of representation, please get in contact or visit the McCabe Curwood website: www.mccabecurwood.com.au.

Baker McKenzie's Funds Group is one of the premier funds legal practices in Australia. The Funds Transaction Group works closely with the firm's real estate, infrastructure, energy and private equity groups to assist clients raise, invest and manage capital both domestically and overseas in those sectors.

The work undertaken is primarily transactional in nature, and includes assisting funds on raising capital and undertaking investments and M&A transactions.

We assist with funds management, financial markets, regulation and advise industry participants on the establishment and offering of  Australian and offshore managed funds and co-investment arrangements, AFS licensing issues, and investment management agreements.

I worked across a range of legal matters associated with investment management, including global private equity investments; investment management agreements; financial services and licensing issues; and a variety of third party contracts such as derivatives trading/clearing agreements, ISDA Master Agreements, advisory agreements, software licences and asset sale documentation.

jobs.companyName: Grantham, Mayo Van Otterloo & Co LLC (“GMO”)
jobs.description:
GMO Australia is a subsidiary of Grantham, Mayo Van Otterloo & Co LLC (“GMO LLC”) a leading privately owned fund manager with total assets under management of approximately USD132 billion (as at 31/12/2014). GMO Australia was established in 1995. With offices in Boston, San Francisco, London, Zurich, Singapore, Sydney and Rotorua, the GMO Group manages long and short strategies in developed equities, emerging equities and fixed income, in addition to asset allocation strategies, hedge funds and forestry/agriculture strategies. 

The role included a broad range of transactional, advisory and strategic work (both locally and globally) with the following main focus areas: 

•Provided general compliance and legal services to support 6 managed investment schemes and separately managed accounts with more than AUD 12 billion under management (AUD 132 billion globally).
•Transitioned to a regional role and helped launch numerous regional initiatives, including the registration of GMO Singapore as a US investment adviser and the adoption of a range of policies and procedures in line with the obligations under the US Investment Advisers Act of 1940.
•Drafted and reviewed legal agreements including investment management, inter-company, outsourcing, delegation, custody, fund registry and administration agreements.
•Provided advice on regulatory compliance and fund related matters, including licensing, AML and regulations with respect to managed investment schemes.
•Drafted product disclosure statements, constitutions and compliance plans for management investment schemes.
•Oversaw the AML/CTF Program and performed the role of the AML/CTF Officer for GMO Asia-Pacific.
•Liaised with regulators including ASIC, AUSTRAC and the Monetary Authority of Singapore.
•Worked alongside senior management to develop appropriate business solutions and models in line with the current regulatory environment.
•Provided compliance expertise and support for GMO firm-wide projects.

UBS is a global firm providing financial services to private, corporate and institutional clients. UBS is present in all major financial centers and have offices in over 50 countries. The Australian business provides services in investment banking, equities, fixed income and currencies to corporates, institutions, governments and individuals. 

I transitioned from FNZ and assisted with the UBS/FNZ investment/wrap platform project. 

•Assisted with the implementation of the UBS/FNZ investment/wrap platform project.
•Assisted in the review of key financial contracts involving the various businesses within UBS including underwriting and trading agreements.
•Provided advice in relation to regulatory compliance issues such as licensing, code of ethics and conflicts of interest.
•Liaised with regulatory bodies on matters such as incidents/breaches and new regulations. 
•Reviewed new rules, regulations and laws to assess the impact on the business with a view to establishing and communicating procedural changes.
•Responsible for the development, approval and review of compliance policies and procedures.
•Worked alongside senior management to develop appropriate business solutions and models in line with the current regulatory environment. 
•Reviewed, monitored and enhanced personal account trading processes for the Investment Banking and Equities Divisions.

FNZ is an investment platform/wrap platform technology provider to major financial institutions in the financial services and wealth management sectors. FNZ provides end-to-end technology, including investment front office, tax and investment back office under software as a service delivery model. This technology is combined with back office dealing, settlement and administration services. FNZ has delivered investment platform solutions to financial companies in the UK, Australia and NZ. FNZ’s customers include AXA Wealth, JPMorgan Asset Management, Standard Life, Zurich Life, Close Brothers Asset Management, Friends Life, HSBC, BNZ, AMP, UBS, OnePath, NAB and First NZ Capital.

I joined FNZ not long after start up in Australia and was responsible for building the legal/compliance and risk frameworks in the Australian and New Zealand operations.

general.headline: Executive Chairperson
general.company: Queensland Bauxite (QBL) ASX listed. Volcan Holdings Inc. (VOHO) US OTC listed.
general.description:
Pnina Feldman - Mining Entrepreneur -Executive Chairperson/President publicly listed and unlisted companies -Principal -Head Shlucha Chabad Sydney NSW-Community leader-Educator- Counsellor-family person.

Pnina Feldman was the first woman in Australia to publicly list a mining company, be the chairperson, CEO and the largest shareholder. This company was known as Diamond Rose NL. The company catapulted Mrs Feldman into the BRW top 200 rich list in the first year of listing. Because of the Guanaco Gold mine in Chile that was purchased by Diamond Rose, the company was taken over by a South American group of investors and is now known as Austral Gold. 

Pnina then founded Australian Gold Investments (AGD) (ASX listed) which because of its later acquired bauxite assets in Queensland, changed its name to Queensland Bauxite (QBL). Pnina is also chairperson of publicly unlisted Plateau Bauxite.

Pnina is also the founding president of Volcan Holdings Inc, a US bulletin board listed company which upon listing, was publicised in the US as the most successful merger of the year. 

Pnina also has access to numerous gemstone mines and tenements, and highly prospective gold and diamond tenements.

Pnina studied Law/Arts at Melbourne University, before graduating Gateshead College England.

Pnina has founded numerous educational, charitable and women’s initiatives, and received the Wentworth community award in 2007 from the then Federal Government Minister and Wentworth MP the Hon Malcolm Turnbull.

Pnina is also Consultant Principal to Yeshiva College Bondi and was founder of Yeshiva Girls High School currently known as Kesser Torah College.

Pninas motto is "Like red wine, meaningful maturity comes with age"

Pnina believes that of all the diversified opportunities open to women, being a devoted wife and mother requires the most complex of skills,and is the greatest privilege to which a woman can aspire.

jobs.jobTitle: Specialist social media strategist, trainer and speaker - CEO
jobs.description:
Social Media AOK provides social media training and services in Adelaide, Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Canberra, Perth, Hobart, Darwin and Regional centers upon request.

At Social Media AOK we like to start out without making assumptions about your business requirements so Coffee is always the best place to start, in getting to know your business and whats important to you, we can provide tailored recommendations to suit your needs.

Including 
> Bespoke training for business owners, managers and staff on social media and applications
   relevant to your business.
> Review and solution provision for applicable social media platforms and associated applications.
> Social Media Brand Management
> Advertising Campaign strategy, creation, and implementation across social media platforms
   including remarketing.
> Event activation strategies for conferences in relation maximising brand awareness and exposure in the lead up to, during and post-event.
> Digital Strategy advice
> Content generation and ongoing social media management.

One of our specialties is working closely with businesses as their coaching and accountability partner to ensure that they are successful in implementing or creating their social media strategy. We do this either one on one or as part of our successful coaching programs that provide a cost-effective way for business owners and managers to acquire the skills they need to manage their social media effectively and productively.

The DoB otherwise known as The Duke of Brunswick Hotel located on Gilbert Street Adelaide is about to undergo a slight transformation to become Adelaide's Business Networking and Event Hub.

Combining multi-use offices upstairs home to a number of fantastic Adelaide businesses and a Seriously Social Business Community along with two bars and a function and training room we have everything you need for a business event, seminar or workshop. 

Our mouthwatering menu and local wines are sure to please as is our specialty roast coffee and the all-day breakfast menu on the Saturday and Sunday.

The transformation is set to commence on October the 24th so get in touch if you are looking for function space this year as we would love to host you.

general.headline: CEO Lithium Australia NL (ASX:LIT)
general.description: Mining Exploration Mineral processing Geopolymers  Specialties: Project development

jobs.description:
Lithium Australia (ASX:LIT) is sole owner of the Sileach process, a hydrometallurgical process for the recovery of metals, lithium in particular, from silicates. The process eliminates the need to roast and hence provides a cost effective alternative to the common pyrometallurgical extraction techniques..

LIT has gained access to lepidolite (lithium mica) deposits in Western Australia, at Ravensthorpe, Coolgardie, Lake Seabrook and in the Pilbara. LIT also has a significant land position covering pegmatites in the Greenbushes pegmatite swarm, host to the world's largest lithium pegmatitie.

LIT has produced proof-of-concept, battery grade lithium carbonate form its deposits in Coolgardie, and Cinovec (Czech Republic) where LIT has a non-binding HoA with European Metals, to process lithium micas. The high-grade product has been produced on a continuous basis in a "mini plant" located in Perth (Western Australia).

The technology being used by LIT to extract lithium, has a small energy footprint, and valuable by-product credits. This combination should make the extraction of lithium from a wide range of lithium silicates, competitive with the lowest cost lithium producers. LIT plans to be producing lithium carbonate on a commercial basis by 2019.

Parkway is a technology developer focused on the extraction of fertilizer commodities from greensands form the worlds largest known occurrence, the Dandaragan Trough. Dandaragan id located close to Perth (Wesren Australia) and inproximity to one of Australia's largest fertilizer consuming areas; the Wetern Australian Wheat Belt. The project is of national importance and will underwrite Australia's food security by decoupling the national reliance on imports of fertilizer.

Parkway is proprietor of the patented K-Max process, originally designed for the recovery of fertilizer from glauconite (a component of greensand) but now finding applications in a wide range of mineral processing scenarios. The Company is also planning to recover rock phosphate from Dandaragan, for the local production of superphosphate.

Parkway is a founder and largest shareholder of Davenport Resources, conventional potash developer in Germany.

Sustainable developer of geopolymer applications.

The company is focused on producing low corbon footprint alternatives to concrete in the construction industry. GCC is researching other environmentally advantageous properties of geopolymers including moisture storarage and discharge, accoustics, acid resistance, ion exchange and superior strength.

general.headline: Professional Athlete at Carlton Football Club
general.description:
Nick joined the Carlton Football Club via the 2012 AFL National Draft. Prior to attaining his dream of becoming a professional athlete, he completed an apprenticeship as a Cabinet Maker in his hometown of Traralgon in Victoria.

In his spare time, since joining the Carlton Football Club he has successfully undertaken a number of courses including;
- Cert II & III in Sport
- Cert IV in Business and a Diploma in Project Management
- Diploma in Leadership/Management 
- Cert IV & Diploma in Building/Construction (current)

Currently enjoying the opportunity to get his hands dirty away from the footy field, Nick worked with Melbourne based Crema Construction in 2016, gaining experience as a project manager with the Project Team on his day off one day a week. In 2017, Nick has joined the team at Johns Lyng Group Insurance Builders, also once a week, to try and gain further skills and experience in all different types of building/construction industries.
Post his playing career Nick is looking forward to moving further into this field, but is continuously looking to build his knowledge and networks in the present.

In early 2016 Nick started as an ambassador with Muscular Dystrophy Australia, helping to raise the profile of a cause he feels incredibly passionate about. Some of what that role entails is connecting affected children with sport via his role at the Carlton Football Club, promoting & being a part of MD’s fundraisers & shooting short films with the hope of raising awareness of Muscular Dystrophy in Australia.
 
Being in the AFL system, Nick has undertaken various amounts of media and public speaking which including things like:
- Media interview (live radio & television)
- Carlton Football Club TV Interviews
- Presentations & facilitation of group learning sessions

jobs.description:
To continue to gain more experiences working within the building industry, at the start
      of this year I made the switch to JLG Insurance Builders. For the past 6 months I have
      been able to get a greater understanding for a different aspect of the building industry
      and I am really enjoying working closely with the Project Supervisors. I have also spent
      time with Estimators, Purchase Officers and Plans/Permits Officers, which has given me
      
      a great understanding of what is involved in their day to day roles.

As football takes up most of my time, I completed work experience with Crema Construction (one day) every week. Being able to go on site for that one day, really helped me to complete the theory side of my studies and also gain a greater structural knowledge/understanding of commercial building. It was an amazing experience in helping me build my knowledge, networks and experiences for my post football career.

jobs.location: Williamtown Raaf, New South Wales, Australia
jobs.description:
Lendlease was the managing contractor delivering the NACC R8000 upgrade to Williamtown Base. The project consists of the Design and Construction of the R8000 NACC Facility for Australian Airforce new F35 Programme. The project includes Runway Extensions, New Taxiways, Aircraft Apron, Buildings and parking for operating the aircraft and service infrastructure for the operation of the facility.

Responsibilities: I put together a number of works packages (largest being $65M) and procured them by following the Government Procurement Guidelines. Once the works packages started on site I managed the Subcontractors ensuring they meet safety, environmental, quality, programme, subcontract, commissioning and handing over  requirements. I managed a number of Graduate Engineers, Site Engineers and Project Engineers through the running of the works packages ensuring the strict Government/Defence processes were followed. I managed the enabling works packages to set up the works area and ensured that the project caused minimal disruption to the operating Defence Base. I developed the staging plan for the civil works which coordinated the interface with the building construction and reduced the risk to the programme. I reviewed the Design to ensure it complies with Defence requirements and that it is fit for purpose, I also provided design & constructability advice to the designers

During the delivery stage of this package I managed all the services included in the civil package and other service packages external to the buildings which involved a lot of coordination with the Defence.

Helen has advised on and defended hundreds of claims for statutory workers compensation benefits for both insurers and self-insurers primarily in the Workers Compensation Commission of New South Wales but also in the Work Health Court of the Northern Territory and the Workers Rehabilitation and Compensation Tribunal of Tasmania.
 
Helen regularly acts in complex and catastrophic injury and recovery claims in the District and Supreme Courts of New South Wales, as well as the Supreme Courts of Tasmania, Victoria, Western Australia, the Australian Capital Territory and the Northern Territory. Helen often provides strategic advice to major Australian insurers, self-insurers and reinsurers on the day-to-day management of these insurance claims.
 
Helen's experience extends to latent personal injury claims which require consideration of historical public liability insurance policies, including claims concerning the sexual abuse of minors.
 
Helen is a valued member of Curwoods’ Corporate Social Responsibility Committee and coordinates the LEAPS (Law Firms Encouraging and Assisting Promising Students) program.  

Helen was one of ten finalists in the Lawyers Weekly Australian Law Awards in the category, Senior Associate of the Year FY2017.

general.headline: Technical Director - PPP and Specialist Services
general.description:
Management of Aquenta Consulting's PPP and specialist advisory services. Encompasses the delivery of commercial, cost, facilities management, risk and program services to both the private and public sectors - from business case to handback. James draws upon industry specialists within Aquenta and Jacobs in the building, transport, utilities, oil & gas and mining markets.

James is well known in PPP industry circles. Having commenced his career in land valuation, commercial property sales and property development, James was part of the early industry response to the modern Public Private Partnership (PPP) model for delivering major works in Australia.

Having being engaged by a number of industry heavyweights including Baulderstone, ABN AMRO, Brookfield Financial and John Laing in various roles, James has developed PPP bids for health, justice, sports, education, transport and emergency services facilities. It’s this depth of experience that enables him to understand what his clients need to optimise their offer or get the most from the market.

James is happiest when in the thick of a bid; delivering rigorous advice as part of financial advisory teams on complex projects; and consulting clients on maximising their capital for optimal financial returns on large infrastructure projects. He is also sought by our clients for his capability in property development conceptualisation and delivery, management of financiers’ due diligence processes, and integration of CAPEX and OPEX solutions.

Recently James has coordinated advice for State side advisory roles including the development of Public Sector Comparator raw cost data (capex and opex) across large road and rail infrastructure projects.

general.headline: Director - Infrastructure and Utilities at Commonwealth Bank
general.description:
Kevin is a Director in the Infrastructure and Utilities team within the Institutional Banking and Markets division of Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA). The Infrastructure and Utilities team is responsible for relationships with clients and Sponsors in sectors such as economic infrastructure (ports, airports, toll roads, and rail); utilities (regulated network assets and energy retailers); and social infrastructure (schools, hospitals and prisons under availability payment structures). The team works closely with key product partners to generate funding and risk management solutions for clients. Key products include project finance, corporate debt, debt and equity capital markets, structured asset finance and hedging solutions.

Prior to joining CBA, Kevin spent 13 years at RBS (formerly ABN AMRO) in the Capital Structuring Advisory, Structured and Project Finance and Financial Markets Advisory divisions of the bank. Previously Kevin had gained his Chartered Accounting qualifications at Ernst & Young.

Kevin has a Bachelors' degree of Commerce from the University of New South Wales, a Masters Degree in Applied Finance from Macquarie University, and is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants Australia.

general.headline: Director, Infrastructure at National Australia Bank
general.description:
I am a banking professional with transaction experience covering financial advisory, structuring, and execution of project and acquisition finance. This has been gained across the infrastructure, transport, utilities and oil & gas sectors. 
I have also had experience in the origination and distribution of syndicated facilities, as well as the development of bespoke structures to meet specific client needs.  
Having worked globally has also given me insights into alternative approaches, and the trends occurring in the financing and provision of infrastructure assets.

jobs.description:
NAB is the #1 provider of project finance for infrastructure in Australia, by volume and
      number of deals.  As a director in the team,  I am responsible for the origination of
      transactions, negotiation of terms and pricing with clients, and the oversight and
      management of the deal team for individual transactions.
      

    
      

    Some key recent transactions I have worked on include the Reliance Rail restructure,
      South Australian and Victorian Land Title office privatisations, the long term lease of
      
      Endeavour Energy, and the refinancing of Axicom.

In this role I managed the North American infrastructure and utilities project finance business, as well as being a member of the Management Committee for the New York branch overall. In addition to this was also active in originating corporate facilities, cross sell of global market products to clients, and undertaking secondary trades.

Participated in the steering committees for the restructuring of several transactions as a result of economic underperformance arising from the GFC, involving extensive negotiations with sponsors and banks, and rebasing of transactions to reflect revised assumptions.

Undertook the underwriting and distribution of corporate and project loans, initially in
      London and then in Sydney upon my repatriation to Australia.  As the Sydney business
      was in ramp up, a significant part of the role involved collaborating with, and
      
      co-ordinating input from, the London and Toronto teams.

I was involved in the structuring and executing project loans predominantly in the Middle East and UK, in the conventional and renewable power, LNG, PPP, shipping and petrochemical sectors.  I was also involved in structuring bespoke transactions for clients, such as contract monetisations and lease structures.

Subsequently moved to the syndicate desk to originate and distribute loans in emerging markets in conjuction with the corporate bankers. Led the distribution of project loans for European and Middle Eastern borrowers.

Managed a portfolio of structured transactions, as well as originating new deals to aid
      in meeting the bank's tax profile.  Negotiated the restructuring of certain deals in
      
      response to changed tax regime and regulatory requirements.

general.school: Curtin Graduate School of Business (Western Australia)
general.description:
Michael Thorpe is the Managing Director, Global Head of Infrastructure and Utilities, for the Commonwealth Bank. He is responsible for strategic advice, client relationships and financing across the utilities sector globally. This includes operations in Australia, Asia, Europe, the United Kingdom and the United States. 

Infrastructure and Utilities is a major part of the Institutional Banking and Markets division of the Commonwealth Bank, which administers financial and risk management services for major corporate and government clients. The team directed by Michael creates sophisticated solutions for businesses seeking growth in a rapidly evolving environment. This includes customised funding arrangements and global markets derivatives products to suit projects across a range of assets, as well as comprehensive transactional banking options. Michael’s deep expertise supports vital national infrastructure such as energy and water utilities, hospitals, schools, prisons, roads, railways and ports. 

Michael has nearly two decades of experience in senior banking roles. He was previously the Commonwealth Bank’s Managing Director, Project Finance, covering client asset acquisitions in the infrastructure, utilities and natural resources sectors. In this role, Michael significantly extended the bank’s global reach into Europe and North America. He was also the Head of Oil and Gas, where he focused on both upstream and downstream operations, as well as domestic and international liquefied natural gas projects.   

In addition, Michael has held various executive and analyst roles in project finance at Lloyds Banking Group, Bank of Scotland and Westpac. He has worked in Sydney, Perth, Brisbane and London.

jobs.description:
Led the Australian Procurement and Logistics function for Wood Group PSN, the largest provider of brownfield services to the oil and gas industry, in support of projects both in Australia and abroad.

Responsible for all Wood Group PSN’s Australian based Procurement and Logistics activity, supported by a large team comprising of Team leaders, Buyers, Expediters, Fabrication Coordinators, Material Controllers and Warehousing personnel.

Developed and implemented numerous Procurement and Logistics strategic plans, working closely with both local and global colleagues, suppliers and clients to implement and monitor programs that were cost–effective, expedient and compliant with all related policies, procedures and business principles.

Successfully recruited, on-boarded and developed over 35 Procurement and Logistics professionals in support of four new client contracts.  Over 90% retention achieved.

Developed procurement strategies and established new processes and systems for centralised procurement activities in accordance with industry best practice.

general.headline: Stakeholder/Community Engagement Consultant at Downer Seymour Whyte Joint Ventur
general.description: Catherine is a senior communications specialist with experience across a wide range of issues-rich, complex and fast-paced sectors including infrastructure management, energy, transport, telecommunications and broadcasting in both the public and private sectors in Australia and abroad. Her strengths include stakeholder/community engagement, strategic media,/issues/reputational management, identifying emerging issues/opportunities, and influencing the media and regulatory agendae.

jobs.location: Princes Highway Berry to Bombaderry Upgrade

jobs.description:
As General Manager Corporate Affairs, Catherine's responsibilities included: differentiating the company from its parent, Transfield Holdings; generating a profile as a leading contender in the highly contested and rapidly growing field of services-outsourcing in Australia, Asia and the Middle East; and working with the Business Development unit to identify and win new business opportunities.. 

Media, Issues and reputational management were key to Catherine's role. She utilised her skills, experience and contacts to undertake media, government and stakeholder relations activities to manage such issues as alleged criminal behaviour by contractors, asbestos removal, mergers and acquisitions and the sale of Transfield Construction, in addition to promoting the company's overall business objectives.

Leading a small team, Catherine was company media spokesperson for the company. She also represented the Company in State and Federal trade negotiations. Catherine wrote a wide range of material including media releases, ASX announcements, speeches, briefing notes and reports - including Annual Reports and the company's first Sustainability Report.

Catherine also managed a diverse events including Annual General Meetings, media and analyst briefings, community engagement events and facility openings.

Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, Catherine's responsibilities included developing and implementing an internal and external communications strategy where none had existed previously.
This strategy entailed:

- positioning the Company with key internal and external stakeholders as credible and dynamic, in contrast to the image it had developed during the incumbency of its previous majority shareholder as a low profile entity on the verge of bankruptcy;

- developing and implementing an internal communications strategy to increase employee contributions to the achievement of business goals by providing them with credible information in a timely manner, introducing input and feedback mechanisms and encouraging their use, and publicly recognising their achievements; and

- providing issues management and communications counsel to the Chief Executive Officer, the Board, members of the Executive and others on matters ranging from anthrax hoaxes and product withdrawals to litigation issues.

In this one year contract, Catherine reported jointly to the Chief Executive Officer of Free TV Australia and the representatives of the three major free-to-air television networks.

Catherine's key achievements in this role included:

- the design and management of a successful campaign to promote High Definition Digital Television (HDTV) - the free-to-air broadcasters' preferred digital standard - targeting and utilising politicians, bureaucrats, regulators, media and manufacturers. The campaign included a major parliamentary and media preview of HDTV - arguably the best-attended industry event ever held at Parliament House;

- developing and implementing, in conjunction with retailer, manufacturer and consumer organisations, a digital-awareness campaign targeting retailers and consumers; and

- developing and implementing a successful national GST-awareness campaign targeting television advertisers and alerting them to the negative consequences of any reduction in expenditure to accommodate the GST (Catherine utilised the services of financial commentator Peter Switzer and a panel of Anderson consultants to participate in a national road show as part of this successful campaign).

Optus Communications was a relative newcomer - and the first competitor to Telstra in the telecommunications space - when Catherine assumed this role. As the first Public Affairs team member assigned to supporting Optus' Corporate and Government business unit, she played a key role in repositioning the company with regulators, politicians and consumers as a provider of comprehensive telecommunications solutions rather than a source of exclusively residential services.

As a member of the Public Affairs team, Catherine also contributed to the development of public affairs strategies for all business units.

Catherine also revamped an existing Speakers' Program, identifying appropriate volunteers from all levels, functional and geographical areas, and working with them to ensure the program created and maximised opportunities to raise awareness and understanding of Optus products and services among existing and potential stakeholders. She placed a major emphasis on mentoring and training speakers and ensuring their participation was a positive feature of their professional development.

Catherine also represented the company in regular meetings with Federal bureaucrats and representatives of bodies associated with the telecommunications industry.

Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, Catherine established a program of political, bureaucratic,
media and membership relations to promote the interests of the real estate sector in Australia. She significantly raised the profile and influence of the Institute and the sector among these target audiences and with the wider community.

Among her major achievements with the Institute was Catherine's key role in an industry campaign to secure approval from the Prices Surveillance Authority for fee self-regulation. She also managed all aspects of a biennial national REIA conference including venue selection and liaison, identification of potential speakers from Australia and abroad and generation of media coverage in advance, during and after the conference,

Catherine's professional development plan had long included a period of lobbying the European Parliament and the European Commission in Brussels. She achieved this when offered a position with Market Access Europe for whom she represented a range of clients including a major multinational pharmaceutical company, a leading UK retail chain, a consortium of Japanese banks and a consortium of US banks.

Her role entailed extensive interaction with the European Parliament and its Committees, as well as the European Commission. 

The experience Catherine gained in Brussels strengthened her skills and has been advantageous in her career back in Australia.

Ed Taylor’s professional engineering experience of 45 years has been predominately in the construction and project management aspects of major road and water tunnels. He has also held a number of management positions in the retail water industry associated with the planning, design and construction of water supply, sewage and drainage schemes.
His tunnelling experience commenced in Melbourne’s sewer and water construction boom period during the early 70’s. This experience lead to a period on the Thomson  Dam tunnel works in the early 80’s and then to the Melbourne City Link Project where he was employed in an engineering management role for the contractor.
Ed’s subsequent experience on various infrastructure tunnels has enabled him to develop a unique range of technical competencies for which he is well renowned. Over the years Ed has fine-tuned the balance between the technical requirements of large civil infrastructure projects and the practical needs of construction requirements.

general.headline: Group Manager Resourcing at John Holland

jobs.description:
John Holland is one of Australia’s leading engineering, contracting and service providers to the infrastructure, energy, resources and transport services sectors.

As a wholly owned subsidiary of China Communications and Construction Company International Holding Limited (CCCI), John Holland operates across Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia. Our business is driven by our collaborative approach to project delivery and the diversity of our skills and capabilities.

We have been providing smarter, safer, more innovative and efficient, high-performance engineering and construction solutions in Australia and internationally for more than 65 years. 
Our experience covers a wide range of contracting and services capabilities, from building and civil construction solutions in the infrastructure sector to the delivery of major tunnelling, water and environment, energy, minerals and industrial projects in the energy and resources sector. We are also a leading provider of services to the transport sector, with industry leading expertise and capability in railway construction, operations and maintenance.

Our parent company, CCCI, is a wholly owned subsidiary of China Communications Construction Company Limited (CCCC), which is listed on the Hong Kong (1800.HK) and Shanghai Stock Exchanges (601800SH). 

CCCC is the largest listed company in the international infrastructure and engineering sector. The company is currently ranked #187 on the Fortune 500 list and #4 in Global Contractors by Engineering News Record (ENR). It is well recognised for technical expertise and execution of complex infrastructure including bridges, high speed rail, deep water port development and social infrastructure.

general.headline: CFO | Director | Investment Professional | Engineer
general.description:
Most recently the Chief Financial Officer (and Director) for Arc Infrastructure, David also has investment professional experience from a decade at Brookfield / Prime Infrastructure / Babcock & Brown during the 2007-2016 period, and he also has a background in engineering from the initial phase of his career in the early 2000’s from his time with Arup.

As the CFO of Arc Infrastructure, David was responsible for the Financial, Legal, Strategy & Risk, Procurement, Business Development and Network Development functional areas of the organisation. David was also an Executive Director for the organisation. 

During his decade as an investment professional, David was focussed on assessing, developing, bidding and executing opportunities and transactions of a merger, acquisition or divestment nature primarily in the infrastructure sector.  David also spent his time performing portfolio management and corporate governance roles, by providing corporate support and shareholder guidance on major strategic and financial initiatives of the various businesses owned by the group.  David was often stationed in India during 2015-2016, building and developing the investment team there whilst concurrently assessing and subsequenlty completing the group’s first infrastructure investment in India and integrating this asset into the global asset portfolio. David also has experience in working on Australian PPP’s from his role at Babcock & Brown in the late 2000's.

David had a firm foundation as an engineer from 2000-2007 in Sydney and London, working for the highly-respected multinational engineering firm Arup. In this role, David designed bespoke building services systems incorporating sustainability-based technical principals for precincts, spaces and buildings using innovative solutions and cutting-edge energy and financial modelling practices.

general.headline: Delivery Director (OpCo) at Northwest Rapid Transit

jobs.description:
Currently seconded from Plenary Group to Northwest Rapid Transit (NRT) as the Delivery Director for the SPV (OpCo).

NRT successfully entered into the head contract with Transport for New South Wales (TfNSW) in late 2014 to deliver the $3.7 billion Sydney Metro Northwest Operations, Trains and Systems (OTS) Public Private Partnership (PPP) project. Plenary Group is an equity investor in the project and was the financial sponsor and capital arranger for the NRT consortium.

The $8.3 billion Sydney Metro Northwest (previously called North West Rail Link) is Australia’s biggest public transport project currently under construction.

Sydney Metro Northwest will be Australia’s first fully-automated metro network, delivering 8 new railway stations, 4,000 new commuter car parking spaces and 5 existing railway stations upgraded to metro status.

This PPP is the largest ever awarded in NSW and will see the NRT consortium deliver the Sydney Metro Northwest by the first half of 2019 and operate and maintain it for the next 15 years.

Next generation metro trains on Sydney Metro Northwest will start with 15 trains an hour during the peak (a train every 4 minutes) and 98 percent on-time running.

Sydney Metro Northwest is the first stage of the new metro network and will transform and modernise public transport in Sydney forever. 

The project features:

Construction of 23km of new electrified, twin track, metro railway between Tallawong Road, Rouse Hill and Epping.

Upgrading the existing 13km Epping to Chatswood railway to metro standards, including the existing stations. 

Australia’s longest rail tunnels – 15km long and up to 58m below ground at their deepest point and a 4km elevated skytrain viaduct. 

A Sydney Metro Train Facility to allow trains to be cleaned, maintained and parked when not in service.

Responsible for managing the design and construction process on Plenary's Public Private Partnership (PPP) projects from bid phase through to the successful commissioning of facilities.

Played key project management roles for numerous high-profile projects in the Education, Health and Defence sectors, including Phases 1 and 2 of the Single LEAP accommodation project for the Australian Department of Defence. Phase 1 was completed in early 2009 and the final of 17 Phase 2 sites moved successfully into operation in February 2014.

Project Director jointly responsible for the successful delivery of the $900m Single LEAP Phase 2 Project, involving the provision of over 3,000 accommodation units spread across 17 sites on 14 ADF Bases and all mainland Australian States and Territories. Involving five tier 1 and 2 builders and numerous local and national stakeholders, with all sites delivered on or ahead of time and budget.

jobs.description:
Led Conneq and its subsidiaries; setting strategy, leading acquisition due diligence and integration,  overseeing operations, and developing an autonomous corporate enterprise.  This position reported to the  CEO and Board of Valemus (formerly Bilfinger Berger Australia).

When first appointed in 2002, Conneq required re-engineering and a new strategic direction.  The first  priorities were to create a senior executive, rebuild staff morale and build the confidence of clients.

All corporate functions were developed and implemented for Conneq to operate autonomously: a financial  system, policies, processes, procedures, a communications plan, a strategic HR program, and risk and  compliance.  The Executive Leadership Team was completely overhauled with Executive Directors for  operations and business development, a Finance Director, an HR Director, a General Counsel and a Strategy  Executive.

From 2002 to 2010 the turnover increased 10 fold and employee numbers grew from 400 to circa 4000.

A five year strategic plan was initiated in 2008 focussing Conneq on three priority industries: power, mining  & minerals, and oil & gas.  Selective opportunities in motorways and water network services were sought.

A program of acquisitions diversified Conneq’s capabilities including EPC contracting (ex Simon Carves),  industrial and mining services, power services, and switchgear design and manufacture.  Integrations of  acquisitions were highly successful with some  more than doubling their turnover and all exceeding  their profit targets.  This is testament to the focus placed on the acquisitions being a cultural as well as  strategic fit with Conneq.

Conneq was a key part of the group’s PPP program including the M2, M7, Graham Farmer Freeway, Cross City Tunnel and Clem7 Motorway. Conneq also provided the Facilities Management for hospital PPP bids which the group undertook.

Led all process engineering & multidisciplinary activities in NSW/ACT: proposals for a
      cold mill facility, silicon smelter, metallurgical carbon facility, quartz mine, waste
      
      reactor, underground coal mine conveyor and train load out system.

Projects included freeways, remote civil and building works for the department of defence, a complex  package of civil and landscaping works for the Sydney Olympics, structural work for the Sydney  Showground. The Mount Owen Coal Mine contract encompassed civil works, a rail loop, buildings, a CHPP, a stacker/reclaimer and a train load-out.

Identification and development of business prospects in mining, quarrying and civil
      
      engineering.  A business plan was prepared and subsequently implemented.

Led Macmahon’s construction business in the Northern Territory and northern Western
      
      Australia.

Project Manager and Site Engineer for civil, contract mining and building projects
      including freeways, bridges, dams, shafts and tunnels, a gold mine, airport works and
      
      sub-divisions.

jobs.jobTitle: Contract Manager at Northwest Rapid Transit | OpCo
jobs.description:
The $8.3 billion Sydney Metro Northwest (previously called North West Rail Link) is Australia’s biggest public transport project currently under construction.

Sydney Metro Northwest will be Australia’s first fully-automated metro network, delivering 8 new railway stations, 4,000 new commuter car parking spaces and 5 existing railway stations upgraded to metro status.

The NSW Government has awarded the $3.7 billion Operations, Trains and Systems contract to Northwest Rapid Transit (NRT).

This Public Private Partnership (PPP) is the largest ever awarded in NSW and will see the NRT consortium deliver the Sydney Metro Northwest by the first half of 2019 and operate and maintain it for the next 15 years.

Next generation metro trains on Sydney Metro Northwest will start with 15 trains an hour during the peak (a train every 4 minutes) and 98 percent on-time running.
Sydney Metro Northwest is the first stage of the new metro network and will transform and modernise public transport in Sydney forever. 

The project features:

Construction of 23km of new electrified, twin track, metro railway between Tallawong Road, Rouse Hill and Epping.

Upgrading the existing 13km Epping to Chatswood railway to metro standards, including the existing stations at Epping (lower level), Macquarie University, Macquarie Park, North Ryde and Chatswood (metro platforms).

Australia’s longest rail tunnels – 15km long and up to 58m below ground at their deepest point. 
Between Bella Vista and Rouse Hill, a 4km elevated skytrain is being built, followed by 4km of bridges, embankments and surface tracks to the terminus.

A Sydney Metro Train Facility to allow trains to be cleaned, maintained and parked at night and off peak is being built at Tallawong Road, Rouse Hill.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer at AMP Capital

jobs.description:
AMP Capital is a market leading specialist investment manager. On behalf of retail and
      institutional clients, we manage over $160 billion in funds across a range of investment
      asset classes including equities, fixed interest, real estate and infrastructure.
      

    
      

    As CEO, I am responsible for leading our global team, our focus on driving AMP
      Capital’s international and domestic growth and delivering outstanding investment
      
      experiences for our investors.

jobs.jobTitle: Director and Chief Investment Officer, Property
jobs.description: I was responsible for leading AMP Capital’s $18.8 billion property investment and management business, responsible for the portfolio management of real estate assets for pooled fund investors and significant separately managed account clients. In addition, I oversaw AMP Capital’s integrated platform of property capabilities across the office, shopping centre and industrial sectors. As Chief Investment Officer, I was responsible for overseeing AMP Capital’s property investment committees, which govern investment strategy and implementation.

As Chief Operating Officer for Property at AMP Capital, I was responsible for AMP
      Capital's wholly-owned asset management businesses AMP Capital Office & Industrial
      and AMP Capital Shopping Centres. I also oversaw the delivery of Property support
      
      functions including Finance, Risk and Compliance, Communications and IT.

As Executive Director, Property and Infrastructure at Macquarie Capital Advisers, I provided corporate advisory services in regard to substantial property transactions, largely to major Australian organisations. My particular focus was on assisting these companies to establish wholesale property funds that were attractive investment propositions to leading international and domestic institutional investors. Major transactions included the acquisition by Transfield Holdings of Century Student Housing business the largest provider of on Campus student housing in USA; Wholesale capital raising for Campus Living Villages Fund a student accommodation business with 25,000 beds across US & Australia; Acted for minority shareholder in sale of interests in Lend Lease Actus a leading US Military Housing Privatisation business; Corporate advisory and wholesale capital raising for establishment of the Mirvac Wholesale Residential Development Partnership; Corporate advisory and wholesale capital raising for the establishment of the Mirvac Wholesale Hotel Fund; Corporate advisory and wholesale capital raising for the Dexus Wholesale Property Fund (DWPF). I also assisted Macquarie on several infrastructure projects.

At Bovis Lend Lease, I led the project management, design and construction activities of Bovis Lend Lease across Asia Pacific., a business with revenues of $2 billion and 1800 people with capability in 14 countries. Australian based projects included Lend Lease’s Victoria Harbour in Melbourne’s Docklands and the new headquarters for National Australia Bank on that site; 126 Phillip Street, Sydney – new  Australian headquarters for Deutsche Bank designed by Norman Foster; MAB’s New Quay development in Victoria; The Bond, Lend Lease’s new offices in Sydney and Australia’s first commercial office building to be rated 5-star environmentally; and the Melbourne Central Redevelopment. During this time I also served as a Director on the Board of Lend Lease Development and was a member of the Project Control Groups for key Lend Lease developments.

As CEO Australia for Bovis Lend Lease, I led the project management, design and construction activities of the business across Australia and projects after the acquisition of Bovis by Lend Lease Corporation. Projects undertaken included SA 2000 – Sydney Airport upgrade; Aurora Place, Sydney; The Sydney Olympic Village, Newington; Jackson’s Landing, Pyrmont, Sydney; Erina Fair Redevelopment, NSW; and Castle Towers, Sydney.

Between 1986 and 1999 I fulfilled numerous roles with Lend Lease Group companies
      encompassing business unit leadership, development, project management,
      
      construction, property management and mergers and acquisitions.

general.description:
Transport for NSW is responsible for improving the customer experience, planning, program administration, policy, regulation, procuring transport services, infrastructure and freight. Transport operating agencies have been freed up to focus on service delivery – providing safe, reliable, clean and efficient transport services.

TfNSW consists of five divisions, three delivery offices and the Office of the Secretary.

At Transport, our vision is for a truly integrated transport system that will meet the needs of our customers now and into the future. The Transport portfolio includes Transport for NSW as principal agency with Sydney Trains, NSW Trains, State Transit Authority and Roads and Maritime Services as our key operating agencies. 

We are a values based organisation and employ the most talented people to work together to deliver services for our customers and make NSW a better place to live, do business and visit.

TfNSW are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport cluster, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTI, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. TfNSW recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of NSW.

My role within TfNSW details aiding in the design and implementation of a major recruitment reform project of Infrastructure and Services.

jobs.description:
Leading the Human Resources Business Partner team (includes (1) Human Resource Business Partner and (1) Human Resource Advisor) responsible for providing strategic HR advice and HR operational support to NSW Science Division, NSW Environment Protection Authority, and Greater Sydney Commission.

Key accountabilities include:
•	Provide high level strategic and operational people management and development advice for client businesses and align business and people strategies, directions and objectives.

•	Support and deliver strategic workforce planning including analysis, forecasting, strategic development and evaluation, and manage its implementation in client businesses to ensure that identified gaps between current and future workforce needs are effectively addressed by integrated business and People & Culture strategies.

•	Facilitate relationships between the division and client businesses to broker the division’s service offerings and identify new opportunities for the division to add value.

•	Provide advice and assist divisional executives  to drive business performance and align business and people strategies, directions and objectives with legislative and organisational requirements.

The downstream success of this one example resulted in the acceptance of a UOW intern into the formal CBA Regional Banking Graduate Program.
